actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Rules.

official_title: A resolution amending Rule XLVI of the Rules of the House to require greater economy in mass mailing and other uses of the frank by Members of the House, and for other purposes.

summary.text: Amends rule XLVI of the Rules of the House of Representatives to require that Members of Congress prepare franked mail (and mass mailings) to qualify for the lowest first-class rate practicable. Prohibits a Member from using the equivalent priority mail rate for franked mail, unless the mail is inherently time sensitive. Decreases, after April 30, 1986, the amount of franked mail to which Members are entitled. Provides a formula to count against limitations on the use of the frank, mail matter for the period beginning on May 1, 1986, and ending on December 31, 1986, that relates to a Member's notice of appearance or scheduled itinerary. Provides a formula, for the period beginning on May 1, 1986, and ending on September 30, 1986, to limit the amount of franked mail a Member may mail that is not in direct response to an inquiry or request.

titles.title: A resolution amending Rule XLVI of the Rules of the House to require greater economy in mass mailing and other uses of the frank by Members of the House, and for other purposes.
